intro: Ptychotis stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-lobed ptychotis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Ptychotis stenoloba is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
